resources:
A → Z Abort command first About ADB Through OTG Use an OTG cable and USB debugging to execute ADB commands on another Android device. You need to turn on USB Debugging in the developer settings of the target device. ADB via Wireless Debugging Connect devices (Android 11+) over Wi-Fi using wireless debugging and execute ADB commands remotely. Crash details Crash history Current version Dark theme Default folder Default language Delete all Contributors and support Check for updates automatically Backup all data of the app Backup and restore app settings and other data Backup app database which includes the command examples Backup app settings preferences only Modify certain behavior of the app History of all the changes made to the app Ask for confirmation before clearing the shell output Choose a directory to save the shell output View all crashes that have occurred in the app Choose the default language for the app Useful when you want to use an external keyboard Automatically set the app theme according to the device wallpaper When turned on, updates will be downloaded directly from Github inside the app. Turn off to visit the Github releases page for manual download instead. Collection of some command templates If you have any ideas or suggestions for the app, let us know Visit the github repository of the app Interactive haptics for touch feedback Pitch black dark theme for devices with OLED display Just a guy who loves apps and design Learn about the license this app is using Dynamic colors, Dark theme, Language Might cause lag if a large number of bookmarks are added! Low end devices should keep this option turned off Pair another target device Report any issue or bug you have encountered while using the app Reset app settings to default values Restore app data from the saved backup file.
The saved database will overwrite the current database Enable this option to save output of the whole shell session.
If disabled only the last command output will be saved. Enables smooth scrolling in the shell output when top or bottom arrow is clicked Join the telegram channel for discussion Description Developer options Developer options not available! Device connected! Device info Disable soft keyboard Disclaimer Running ADB commands can modify system settings, manage files, and perform operations that may affect your device’s stability.
You are solely responsible for any changes made using this app. Use at Your Own Risk While root access is not mandatory, certain commands may require elevated permissions.
Misuse of ADB commands can lead to data loss, app crashes, or unexpected system behavior. Root is not Mandatory, but Caution Needed The developer(s) of this app are not responsible for any damage, data loss, or unintended consequences resulting from the use of this app.
Proceed with caution and ensure you understand the commands you execute. We Are Not Liable This app is designed for users who have a basic understanding of ADB commands.
If you are unsure about a command’s effect, research it before executing it. Intended for Advanced Users This app may require special permissions to function properly.
It does not collect or share personal data, but users should be aware of the implications of granting ADB-related permissions. Permissions and Security Disconnected! Item has been deleted successfully Label Last backup date Last backup time Latest version Lead developer Least used License Load predefined commands Loading Local ADB Local ADB shell Execute ADB commands directly on your device using Shizuku or root. Look & Feel Mode Use root access to run commands. Rooted commands can be executed. Use shizuku to run commands. Commands that require root won't execute. Monospace Most used Network error Newest No ADB-compatible devices found. Enable USB debugging on the target. No adb interface found No bookmarks found No changelog found for this version No crashes have been reported. aShell You is running smoothly. No command history No root access No search results found None Nothing to clear Nothing to search To complete the pairing process you will need to interact with a notification from aShell You. Please allow notification access to aShell You. Notification settings If you cannot enter the Pairing Code from the notification, then you might need to change the Notification Shade to Android. Go to Notification Settings ~ Notification Style to change the Notification Style. Otherwise you might not be able to enter the pairing code from the notification. Off Oldest On Open OR OTG Override maximum bookmarks limit Pair Pair another device Pair manually Pair this device Pair using QR Paired Pairing Pairing code You will receive a notification from aShell You to help you with pairing Paste Permission denied Granting these permissions is optional! Please pick a file with .ashellyou extension Port Pre-release Pre-release builds may be unstable These versions are still in testing and may contain unfinished features or unexpected bugs. If you choose to update to a pre-release, please be aware that things might break or behave strangely.
If you encounter any issues, crashes, or weird behavior, please report them so we can fix and improve aShellYou before the stable release.
Thanks for helping us build better! To pair an Android 11+ device, scan this QR from the target device QR scanner available at:
Developer Options > Wireless Debugging > Pair using QR Code Quick tools Reboot options Recovery Report Report issue Request timeout Reset Reset app settings Reset settings failed Reset settings successful Restore Restore app data The data in the saved file will override the current data. Restore failed Restore successful Root Root access granted! Save Save whole output Search Search commands here Search labels here Search output here Searching connect service Searching for devices… Self Settings The output of last command is exported to '%s' The shell output is exported to '%s' Shizuku Shizuku is not installed Shizuku is unavailable Shizuku is not installed or properly configured on your device Smooth scrolling Sort Stable Stack trace Start Success Device is connected successfully. You can now start running commands on the target device. Like what I do?
Consider buying me a coffee Switch mode System System font System settings Telegram channel Terminal Terminal font style Turn off Mobile Data if the Wifi connection has NO INTERNET Tweak your experience Undo Unknown error occurred Permission not granted. Please allow app installation from unknown sources. Update Update available ! Update channel Use Version Version code Version name Click on the download button to get the latest version of aShellYou from the github repository. Waiting for device What's new! Which device would you like to pair? To use the Wireless Debugging feature, your device must be connected to a Wi-Fi network. If your Wi-Fi connection has no Internet access then turn off mobile data for a solid Wi-Fi connection. Go to Developer options > Wireless Debugging. Tap on Pair device with Pairing Code. Enter the six digit Pairing Code into the notification sent by aShell You. Come back to the app and click on the "Start" button in the home screen. Please note that the left part of the Wireless Debugging option is clickable. Tapping on it will open the Wireless Debugging Pairing menu. Z → A /** * Changelogs * Created by DP-Hridayan * Absolutely necessary to follow this string name format * Use 
 to separate changelog lines for bullet points in UI * Use this exact res ID naming format, eg: for v6.0.0 -> changelog_v6_0_0 */ 
Whole UI Revamped, using material expressive components
Rewritten whole codebase in Kotlin and Jetpack Compose as UI Framework
Added QR Wifi Adb Pairing mode
Added app settings and database backup options
Added custom theming options
Added crash history to view app crash logs
Improved auto update feature
Improved UI & UX in shell output
Revamped command examples layout to include labels
Added option to Add, Edit or Delete commands as you wish
Lots of existing bugs are now fixed 
Now command search can search the commands that contains the word you typed compared to previous versions where it only searched commands that starts with the typed word.
Option to open Shizuku app directly when Shizuku is installed but not running.
Fixed the broken in app crash reporter. 
Fixed the issue which caused per app translations to be broken for aShell You 
Adapted Github Actions for release builds.
What this means for you?
All subsequent builds including this will be more secure! 
Maintenance update 
Added WIRELESS DEBUGGING mode for running ADB commands on both own or other device
Redesigned homepage for minimal navigation and less cluttery input field screen
Added Warning feedback when executing commands involving critical system packages
Added in-app updater. Now you can directly download the latest package without visiting Github repository
Fixed a lot of bugs 
Maintenance update 
UI improvements
Fixed some bugs 
Small UI improvements 
Huge UI and UX improvements across all sections of the app
Added ROOT and BASIC shell in addition to Shizuku shell for running commands
Added option to save output in custom directory
Fixed a lot of bugs and issues
Optimised app's code for better performance and stability 
Added vibration for haptic feedback
Added option to change app language from within the app (for devices running Android 13 and above only and excluding unsupported devices)
Fixed some crashes and improved crash reporting
Minor UI improvements 
Now app catches any crashes and provides the option to report them via email 
Added option to open saved output directly
Added option to save whole output or the last command output only
Fixed crashes 
Fixed an issue with Sharing text to aShell You where the text did not appear when app was starting fresh
Fixed minor UI issues 
Stable release of OTG mode
Added features like save, share, quick scroll buttons to the OTG mode
Added info cards for quick information
Added in app update checker along with the option to auto check for updates
Minor UI improvements 
Fixed some issues in OTG adb support
Updated translations 
Updated dependencies
Added more command examples 
Fixed AMOLED theme not working on devices running Android 11 or below 
Now you can Pin commands for quick access

Bug fixes and lot of code optimisations 
Now you can directly use commands from the Commands section instead of the need to copy them every time

Added option to delete all bookmarks
In search : You can now search in commands summary by clicking a prompt chip
Added sorting options in Commands templates
Added option to directly bookmark selected items in Commands section
Chip Indicator shows connected device(currently only in local ADB mode)
Fixed bugs causing crashes in devices running Android 11 or below
Added Turkish translation
Minor UI improvements
Lot of other bug fixes 
Added total bookmarks count
Fixed some bugs 
Added Search in commands section
Added option to set default working mode
Improved animations
Reworked bookmarks section and added sorting options
Increased bookmarks limit to 25
Removed ADB shell launcher shortcut and added Commands launcher shortcut
Fixed padding issues in button navigation
Fixed some buttons shape 
App uses a more refreshed color palette for material you theming
Fixed minor bugs 
Fixed some crashes that were introduced in v3.8.0 
Added black (amoled) theme
Added undo button to undo paste
Added option to disable soft keyboard
Fixed buttons stretched in some screen sizes
Fixed bookmarks button not appearing after opening the app
Renamed Examples section to Commands
Fixed copy command option not appearing for every command template
App now uses system font everywhere
Improved UI handling
Updated translations 
Now you can share texts from anywhere on your device to aShell You and run commands directly.
Now you can share shell output directly without needing to save it !
A lot of optimisations and UI handling.
Added Chinese translations.
Updated translations.

Added option to clear the command input field after an error
Fixed a bug which caused the app to crash upon pasting from clipboard under certain conditions
Code optimisations 
Fixed some issues with bottom navigation. 
Revamped About section of the app.
Added launcher shortcuts.
Fixed navigation menu not showing in button navigation.
Improved bottom navigation menu visibility on scrolling.
Added per app language support for aShell You (translations aren't completed yet).
A lot of code optimisations. 
Added a Paste button so that you can copy and paste commands quickly.
Added Error indicators in the text input field.
Improved Navigation Bar visibility logic.
Fixed an issue where switches misbehaves under certain situations.
Fixed add bookmark icon visibility in various contrast levels.
A lot of code optimisation. App now opens a lot faster than before.
App will stay in background and won't restart every time you close the app by just pressing the back button or gesture. 
Added bookmarks , history and command suggestions to OTG
Added maximum bookmarks limit.
Added option to override maximum bookmarks limit.
A lot of bug fixes.
Improved some UI handling.
A lot of code optimisation. 
A lot of UI related improvements.
Added chips that indicate current ADB working mode.
A lot of code optimisation. 
Improvements to ADB OTG after initial release.
Some UI and logic adjustments to accomodate the new otg feature. 
Added ADB THROUGH OTG support.

*** You will be able to run ADB commands on other devices using aShellYou by connecting the other device using an OTG cable *** 
Removed unnecessary code and resources.
Minor UI changes. 
Removed unnecessary code and resources.
Minor UI changes. 
Changed app name to aShell You.
Added predictive back animations for supporting devices.
Added confirmation dialog popup before clearing screen.
Fixed StatusBar elements not properly visible in Light mode.
App is much more smooth now.
~ Reduced app size and optimised code.
Added themed icon for launchers that support themed icons.
Minor UI changes. 
Revamped Settings panel.
Added Double Tap to instant scroll to top and bottom positions in shell output view.
Minor UI fixes. 
Added Settings panel.
Added option to disable smooth scroll in shell output.
Fixed major bugs:

 ~ Crash while changing device theme.

 ~ Crash while trying to save large shell output . eg : output of 'pm' command. 
Replaced some deprecated api.
Minor UI changes. 
Added Scroll To Top and Scroll To Bottom buttons.
Added Click keyboard Enter key to Send command.
Added some commands.
Updated dependencies to include latest material you library.
Minor UI changes. 
Added some more command examples.
Minor UI changes.
Changed package name to avoid version confusion with original app. 
Added changelogs into the app.
Added highlighted shell output.
Minor UI changes. 
Added dynamic material theming.
Revamped whole UI to give a fresh look.
